matter.summary: Maria Garcia, 67, slipped and fell on a wet floor in the produce section of MegaMart on September 8, 2024. She sustained a fractured hip requiring surgery. Store employees had been mopping but failed to post warning signs or barricade the area. Surveillance video captured the incident and prior customers nearly slipping in the same location.

documents.title: Incident Report
documents.summary: Store manager Carlos Ruiz completed incident report acknowledging floor was wet from recent mopping. No wet floor signs were in place. Manager admitted employee 'forgot' to place signage.
facts: Floor had been mopped 10 minutes before fall
No warning signs or barriers placed
Employee acknowledged in report that signage should have been used

documents.title: Surveillance Video
documents.summary: Security footage shows employee mopping area at 2:15 PM. At 2:22 PM, two customers are seen carefully navigating the wet area. At 2:25 PM, Ms. Garcia enters the area and immediately slips, falling hard on her right side.
facts: Video clearly shows wet, reflective floor surface
No visible warning signs in footage
Two prior customers nearly slipped in same spot
Employee visible in background, did not warn customers

documents.title: Emergency Room Records
documents.summary: Methodist Hospital ER diagnosed right hip fracture (femoral neck). Orthopedic surgeon consulted. Patient admitted for surgery next morning.
facts: Right femoral neck fracture requiring ORIF (open reduction internal fixation)
Patient has diabetes which complicates healing
Patient lives alone and will require extended rehabilitation

documents.title: Surgical Report
documents.summary: Dr. Kumar performed successful ORIF with screws and plate. Post-op prognosis: 6-8 months recovery with physical therapy. Patient will likely have permanent mobility limitations.
facts: Hardware permanently implanted
Risk of arthritis and future hip replacement (60% probability)
Patient non-weight bearing for 8 weeks minimum

documents.title: Physical Therapy Progress Notes
documents.summary: After 7 weeks of therapy, patient shows slow progress. Still requires walker. Therapist notes patient unlikely to return to pre-injury independence level.
facts: Significant loss of range of motion
Chronic pain limiting function
Patient now requires home health aide services

documents.title: Store Maintenance Logs
documents.summary: Logs obtained through discovery show no documentation of floor cleaning procedures being followed. Multiple gaps in sign-out of safety equipment.
facts: Wet floor signs were available but not used
No supervisor signature approving floor cleaning
Prior incident reports show 3 other slip-and-falls in same area in past year

events.description: Slip and fall incident at MegaMart, 2:25 PM
Returned home with home health services

facts: Defendant had actual knowledge of wet floor condition
Condition posed unreasonable risk of harm
Defendant failed to warn customers or barricade area
Prior similar incidents provided notice of recurring hazard
Employee improperly trained on safety procedures
No supervision of cleaning activities
Failure to enforce safety protocols

authorities.cite: Tex. Civ. Prac. & Rem. Code ยง 75.001

authorities.summary: Texas pattern jury instruction for premises liability

authorities.cite: Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. v. Gonzalez, 968 S.W.2d 934 (Tex. 1998)
authorities.summary: Store owner's duty to warn of or make safe known dangerous conditions

authorities.cite: Corbin v. Safeway Stores, Inc., 648 S.W.2d 292 (Tex. 1983)
authorities.summary: Premises owner must use reasonable care to protect invitees from dangerous conditions

strengths: Video evidence clearly shows hazard and fall
Store's own incident report admits failure to post signs
Prior similar incidents show notice of recurring problem
Elderly victim with severe permanent injury
weaknesses: Defendant may argue plaintiff should have seen the wet floor
Need to establish exact duration floor was wet
concessions: Willing to waive future medical costs if fair settlement on past damages
Open to structured settlement including Medicare Set-Aside
evidentiary_gaps: Need life care plan for future care needs
Pending economic expert report on home health costs
